summary: Email correspondence between Martin Weinberg and an unnamed recipient discussing case management issues for US v Epstein, including protective orders and discovery rollout. The email exchange occurred on July 19, 2019, shortly before Epstein's death.

persons.name: Martin Weinberg
persons.context: Attorney for Jeffrey Epstein in the US v Epstein case, initiating discussion about case management issues including protective orders and discovery rollout.

keyFacts: Email correspondence dated July 19, 2019, discussing case management for US v Epstein.
Martin Weinberg, Epstein's defense attorney, is coordinating with another party (likely prosecution or court) about procedural matters.
Topics include protective orders and discovery rollout, indicating active pre-trial preparation.
The timing is significant as this was just weeks before Epstein's death on August 10, 2019.
The document shows legal proceedings were actively moving forward shortly before Epstein's death.
